content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of two stone furnaces positioned at (0.0, 0.0) and (5.0, 0.0) each paired with dedicated burner‑inserters and wooden chests that manage input and output for smelting operations.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
Consists of a burner‑mining drill positioned at (–15.0, –50.0) linked to a nearby wooden chest at (–13.5, –51.5) and integrated into a transport‑belt network that distributes the extracted ore.

### Steam Power Generation System
Consists of a boiler located at (8.0, 20.5) (currently out of fuel) and a series of steam engines (labeled as generators) placed at:
• (0.5, 9.5)
• (18.5, 11.5)
• (1.5, 13.5)
• (13.5, 14.5)
• (19.5, 14.5)
• (22.5, 18.5)
• (17.5, 20.5)
• (12.5, 21.5)
• (4.5, 23.5)
Additionally, an extra steam engine remains unplaced due to severe congestion in the boiler zone and an obstructed buildable area in the vicinity of (8.5, 22.5).

### Automation Research Lab
Consists of a lab entity configured for automation science pack research; however, it is currently experiencing unstable power connectivity.

### Electrical and Transport Infrastructure
Consists of an integrated network that includes electrical poles and Electricity Groups, BeltGroups that organize transport belts, and PipeGroups that bundle fluid pipes. These systems coordinate the flow of power, fluids, and materials across production areas.

### Offshore Pump and Fluid Network
Consists of an offshore pump located at (0.5, 30.5) which feeds water into the fluid system via a network of connected pipes.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Persistent Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue
  – The extra steam engine remains unplaceable due to severe congestion in the boiler area. Overlapping and misaligned burner‑inserters and transport belts, together with an obstructed buildable zone near (8.5, 22.5), prevent its installation.
  – Recommendation: Perform a thorough manual inspection of the boiler region and surrounding connections. Remove, reposition, or adjust interfering entities and consider relocating the extra steam engine or modifying the boiler layout to create sufficient clearance.

• Burner Fuel Supply Shortages
  – Multiple burner‑inserters and the burner‑mining drill are frequently reporting “out of fuel” or “waiting for source items.”
  – Recommendation: Ensure that fuel sources are properly positioned adjacent to these burner‐powered entities and that a continuous fuel supply is maintained.

• Steam Engine Connectivity and Fluid Input Issues
  – Numerous steam engines display warnings including “not connected to power network” and “no input liquid.”
  – Recommendation: Review and reconfigure electrical cabling and fluid pipe arrangements to ensure that all steam engines are properly connected to their respective power and fluid networks.

• Laboratory Power Deficiency
  – The automation research lab is experiencing a deficit in stable power connectivity.
  – Recommendation: Reassess the placement and configuration of nearby electrical poles and wiring to provide a reliable power supply to the lab.

• General Layout Congestion
  – The boiler area is highly congested, which is impeding the placement of the extra steam engine and possibly affecting other connectivity issues.
  – Recommendation: Reevaluate the spatial layout to reduce overlap and clear obstructed buildable zones, thereby ensuring that all structures can be properly placed and interconnected.
